awd_abstract_narration: The Mathematical Sciences Department of Appalachian State                  University will construct a mathematical science microcomputer                  teaching laboratory for their calculus and discrete mathematics                 sequences.                                                                                                                                                           An electronic classroom of interconnected student workstations,            printers and instructor demonstration unit will provide instant                 computer access during lectures.  The laboratory will be used by                students to conduct experiments and complete out-of-class assignments.                                                                                               Members of the faculty have developed a new curricula, software            and are writing a calculus laboratory manual.                                                                                                                        The grantee is providing a slightly greater sum obtained from non-         Federal sources.
